Exaggerate: Donald Trump twists the excerpts from Hillary Clinton's speeches to make them appear more damaging than they actually are.
Lack enough support: The full speeches that Clinton gave are not available, and the authenticity of the leaked emails has not been confirmed by the Clinton campaign.
Problematic assumption: Trump assumes that Clinton's concern about refugees in Jordan being vetted properly translates to ISIS infiltrating refugees in the United States.
Contradict fact: Trump falsely attributes a quote to Sidney Blumenthal, when in fact it was written by a Newsweek reporter.
Understate: No specific examples of this bias are present in the expert's verdict.
Falters at times: No specific examples of this bias are present in the expert's verdict.
Exist alternative explanation: No specific examples of this bias are present in the expert's verdict.
